Sentencas: Oxides are critical materials for energy devices like solid oxide cells, catalysts, and membranes.
Titulo: Surface chemistry and porosity engineering through etching reveal ultrafast oxygen reduction kinetics below 400°C in B-site exposed (La,Sr)(Co,Fe)O3 thin-films

Sentencas: Their performance is often limited by their catalytic activity at reduced temperatures.
Titulo: Surface chemistry and porosity engineering through etching reveal ultrafast oxygen reduction kinetics below 400°C in B-site exposed (La,Sr)(Co,Fe)O3 thin-films

Sentencas: In this work, a simple etching process with acetic acid at room temperature was used to investigate how oxygen exchange is influenced by surface chemistry and mesoporous structuring in single-crystalline epitaxial (La0.60Sr0.40)(0.95)(Co0.20Fe0.80)O-3.
Titulo: Surface chemistry and porosity engineering through etching reveal ultrafast oxygen reduction kinetics below 400°C in B-site exposed (La,Sr)(Co,Fe)O3 thin-films

Sentencas: Using low energy ion scattering and electrical measurements, it is shown that increasing the B-site transition metal cation surface exposure (most notably with Fe) leads to strongly reduced activation energy from E-a approximate to 1 eV to E-a approximate to 0.4 eV for oxygen exchange and an order of magnitude increased oxygen exchange kinetics below 400 degrees
Titulo: Surface chemistry and porosity engineering through etching reveal ultrafast oxygen reduction kinetics below 400°C in B-site exposed (La,Sr)(Co,Fe)O3 thin-films

Sentencas: C. Increasing the active area by similar to 200% via mesoporous structuring leads to increased oxygen reduction rates by the same percentage.
Titulo: Surface chemistry and porosity engineering through etching reveal ultrafast oxygen reduction kinetics below 400°C in B-site exposed (La,Sr)(Co,Fe)O3 thin-films

Sentencas: Density functional calculations indicate that a B-site exposed surface with high oxygen vacancy concentration can explain the experimental results.
Titulo: Surface chemistry and porosity engineering through etching reveal ultrafast oxygen reduction kinetics below 400°C in B-site exposed (La,Sr)(Co,Fe)O3 thin-films

Sentencas: The work opens a pathway to tune surfaces and optimize oxygen exchange for energy devices.
Titulo: Surface chemistry and porosity engineering through etching reveal ultrafast oxygen reduction kinetics below 400°C in B-site exposed (La,Sr)(Co,Fe)O3 thin-films
